Kuwait. She counseled patience. George H. W. Bush 's Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, General Colin Powell , was as hesitant as April Glaspie . His military options to retake Kuwait, National Security Adviser Brent Scowcroft groused, had not seemed designed by anyone eager to undertake the task.
